speaker: YOUNGER GLAZEBROOK SON
line: Stop! Oh, Dad, cut it out.

speaker: OLDER GLAZEBROOK SON
line: Beautiful, Dad.

speaker: JERALD GLAZEBROOK
line: Quit picking on your brother. Remember he loves you!

speaker: YOUNGER GLAZEBROOK SON
line: No, I don't!

speaker: OLDER GLAZEBROOK SON
line: We're glad you're back home, Dad.

speaker: JERALD GLAZEBROOK
line: Ah, not as glad as I am.

speaker: OLDER GLAZEBROOK SON
line: Did you see a lot of weird stuff this year?

speaker: JERALD GLAZEBROOK
line: Yup, it was the weirdest show ever. But right now, your mother thinks you guys are getting ready for bed and if she comes out here and finds you guys still in the pool, she's going to kill me. So come on, out of the pool.

speaker: YOUNGER GLAZEBROOK SON
line: Awww...

speaker: OLDER GLAZEBROOK SON
line: Awwww, Dad...

speaker: JERALD GLAZEBROOK
line: Quit your whining. Come on or no bedtime story. Out you go, that's it.

speaker: OLDER GLAZEBROOK SON
line: Come on, Dad, there's no school tomorrow...

speaker: JERALD GLAZEBROOK
line: What the hell?

speaker: SCULLY
line: What happened to him?

speaker: MULDER
line: Nothing you can ascertain from that photograph. The victim suffered from ichthyosis, a congenital skin disease characterized by the shedding of the epidermis in the form of scales. This shows the entry wound of the undetermined weapon. There were no other injuries inflicted upon the body, no internal organs removed and/or cannibalized, and there's no signs of sexual molestation either. That's forty-eight attacks over the last twenty-eight years. Occurring in every state in the continental U.S. almost, the first in Oregon and the last five in Florida. The victims range from all different age groups, races, both male and female. The mutilations appear so motiveless that one would suspect some form of ritual yet they adhere to no known cult. A lone serial killer would have been expected to escalate the level of violence of his attacks over such an extended period of time. So what do you think, Scully? What are your initial thoughts?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Imagine going through your whole life looking like this.

speaker: PRIEST
line: "The Lord is my shepherd, I shall not want. He maketh me to lie down in green pastures, he leadeth me beside the still waters. He restoreth my soul. He leadeth me in the paths of righteousness for his name's sake. Yea, though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death..." "I will fear no evil for thou art with me. Thy rod and thy staff, they comfort me. Thou preparest a table before me in the presence of my enemies." "Thou anointest my head with oil, my cup runneth over. Surely, goodness and mercy shall follow me..." "...all the days of my life, and I will dwell in the house of the lord forever." We are gathered here today to mourn the passing of Jerald Glazebrook. Beloved husband, father, friend and entertainer.

speaker: HAMILTON
line: Help...

speaker: MAN #1
line: I got it...

speaker: WOMAN #1
line: Move it out of there...

speaker: WOMAN #2
line: Oh my lord!

speaker: MAN #2
line: I don't believe it...

speaker: BLOCKHEAD
line: Having not known the deceased personally, I am in no position to perform a proper eulogy. I'm sure he was a nice guy, et cetera, et cetera. But as an admirer of the man's work, I am in a position to perform an impromptu tribute in his honor. Namely, ramming this spike into my chest!

speaker: MAN #3
line: You crazy, don't you have any respect at all?

speaker: BLOCKHEAD
line: I think I hit my left ventricle!

speaker: WOMAN #2
line: This is a funeral!

speaker: BLOCKHEAD
line: Get back, fascist!

speaker: MAN #2
line: For crying out loud!

speaker: MAN #4
line: Get him out of here! Get him out of here!

speaker: WOMAN #3
line: You're awful!

speaker: MULDER
line: I can't wait for the wake.

speaker: MULDER
line: On his vicap form, Jerald Glazebrook's occupation is listed as artist.

speaker: HAMILTON
line: Jerry was an artist... the best escape artist since Houdini. He should have been headlining Vegas but his skin condition kept him on the sideshow circuit.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I guess I didn't realize that sideshows were still in existence.

speaker: HAMILTON
line: There are about two or three of them still around.

speaker: MULDER
line: I got the impression that Glazebrook wasn't the only sideshow performer residing here.

speaker: HAMILTON
line: The town was founded back in the 20s when some of Barnum and Bailey's troops started coming down here during the winter off-season.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You know, this town's history might help explain our case's history. A sideshow performer would have toured much of the country over the years. And their isolation from everyday society caused by their physical deformities could have built up pathological resentments so intense that murder might be...

speaker: HAMILTON
line: Now, now, hold on a second. Around here, we refer to them as "very special people." Now, some of them may be different on the outside but it's what's inside that counts. And on the inside, they're as normal as anybody.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Until their arrests, many serial killers are considered by their friends and family to be quite "normal." If you truly regard these people as normal, then you must also consider the possibility that they are capable of committing these crimes.

speaker: HAMILTON
line: It's just been my experience that many people have a harder time accepting these people's deformities than they do themselves.

speaker: MULDER
line: Sheriff, what is this? This design here, it's, uh, copyrighted by Hepcat Helm. Is that a local artist?

speaker: HAMILTON
line: A bit too local. His workplace is right behind my station house.

speaker: MULDER
line: Do you think that we could meet Hep... cat?

speaker: HAMILTON
line: Hepcat! Hepcat!

speaker: HEPCAT HELM
line: Who are the rubes?

speaker: HAMILTON
line: These are F.B.I. Agents Scully and Mulder. This is Hepcat Helm. He operates a carnival funhouse.

speaker: HEPCAT HELM
line: Oh man, how many times have I told you not to call it that? It's not some rinky-dink carny-ride. People go through it, they don't have fun. They get the hell scared out of them. It's not a funhouse, it's a tabernacle of terror.

speaker: HAMILTON
line: It's a funhouse.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mister Helm, I wanted to ask you about this menu illustration. I recognized most of the historical portraits you've drawn here, but what's this here?

speaker: HEPCAT HELM
line: It's the Feejee Mermaid.

speaker: HAMILTON
line: Is that what that thing is?

speaker: SCULLY
line: What's the Feejee Mermaid?

speaker: HEPCAT HELM
line: The Feejee Mermaid. It's, it's the Feejee Mermaid!

speaker: HAMILTON
line: It's a bit of, uh... humbug Barnum pulled in the last century.

speaker: HEPCAT HELM
line: Barnum billed it as a real live mermaid but when people went into see it, all they saw was a real dead monkey sewn on the tail of a fish.

speaker: MULDER
line: A monkey?

speaker: HEPCAT HELM
line: A mummified monkey.

speaker: HAMILTON
line: It supposedly looked so bad, he had to exhibit it as a "genuine fake."

speaker: HEPCAT HELM
line: Oh, but see? That's why Barnum was a genius. You never know where the truth ends and the humbug begins. He came right out and said, "This Feejee Mermaid thing is just a bunch of B.S." That just made people want to go and see it even more. So, I mean... who knows? Maybe for box office reasons, Barnum hocked it as a hoax... when in reality...

speaker: MULDER
line: The Feejee Mermaid was a reality. Sheriff, we're going to need to find a place to stay tonight.

speaker: HAMILTON
line: There are lodgings right across the way, but, uh... what's all this about?

speaker: MULDER
line: These tracks were found at several of the past few crime scenes. They've defied exact identification but one expert speculated that they might be simian in nature.

speaker: HAMILTON
line: You don't mean to tell me you think these tracks were made by the Feejee Mermaid?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Do you recall what Barnum said about suckers?

speaker: MULDER
line: Tell me, have you done much circus work in your life?

speaker: NUTT
line: And what makes you think I've ever spectated a circus, much less been enslaved by one?

speaker: MULDER
line: I know that many of the citizens here are former circus hands and I just thought that maybe you would have done...

speaker: NUTT
line: You thought that because I am a person of short stature that the only career I could procure for myself would be one confined to the so-called "big top." You took one quick look at me and decided that you could deduce my entire life. Never would it have occurred to you that a person of my height could have possibly obtained a degree in hotel management.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm sorry, I meant no offense.

speaker: NUTT
line: Well, then why should I take offense? Just because it's human nature to make instantaneous judgments of others based solely upon their physical appearances? Why, I've done the same thing to you, for example. I've taken in your all-American features, your dour demeanor, your unimaginative necktie design......and concluded that you work for the government. An F.B.I. agent. But do you see the tragedy here? I have mistakenly reduced you to a stereotype. A caricature. Instead of regarding you as a specific, unique individual.

speaker: MULDER
line: But I am an F.B.I. agent.

speaker: NUTT
line: Register here, please.

speaker: MULDER
line: Tell me, have you done much circus work in your life?

speaker: LANNY
line: I was on the stage for most of my life. I was a headliner.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did it not bother you to have other people staring at you?

speaker: LANNY
line: Best work I ever had. All I had to do was stand there. Occasionally, I'd say... "Ladies and gentlemen, I'd like you to meet my brother Leonard." "Excuse him, he's a little shy." Big laughs, I tell you, big laughs.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why'd you give it up?

speaker: LANNY
line: Mister Nutt, the kindhearted manager here, convinced me that to make a living by publicly displaying my deformity lacked dignity... so now I carry other people's luggage. I believe these are your trailers. If they are not, then I am wrong. Oh, that's most considerate. Thank you very much. Good night. Sleep tight. Don't let the bedbugs bite. No, no! That, that's not what I meant. I, I didn't mean to imply we had bedbugs. I, I meant to say, "Don't let... don't let the..."

speaker: MULDER
line: The Feejee Mermaids bite.

speaker: LANNY
line: Yes, that's right, the Fee, the Feejee Mermaids. Don't, that's right, that's... That, that's exactly... the Feejee Mermaids bite...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, what is this Feejee Mermaid business?

speaker: MULDER
line: Every murder investigation begins with a list of possible suspects. You should try not to be so exclusive, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: As long as you try not to let the atmosphere of this town distort your list all out of proportion.

speaker: HEPCAT HELM
line: What the hell?

speaker: LANNY
line: Uh, ma'am... sheriff, he, uh... wants to see you. There's been another murder.

speaker: WOMAN ON APB WIRE
line: Unit Thirteen, man down...

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey, Scully, there's some blood on the window here we should send to the lab.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why run a test on the victim's blood?

speaker: MULDER
line: No, not this window. This window. This seems to be the point of entry and there's a... smear of blood on the outside of the window.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why would there be blood before the attack?

speaker: HAMILTON
line: Why didn't the attacker just come through the open door? For a person to crawl in and out of these windows, they'd have to be a contortionist... or just plain crazy. Or both.

speaker: MULDER
line: While they're performing the autopsy, I want to go down to the...

speaker: BLOCKHEAD
line: How many people do you know that can get out of a straitjacket in under three minutes?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Fortunately, none.

speaker: MULDER
line: We caught your act yesterday at the funeral. That was some trick with the railroad spike.

speaker: BLOCKHEAD
line: Doctor Blockhead does not perform "tricks." Doctor Blockhead performs "astounding acts of body manipulation and pain endurance."

speaker: SCULLY
line: You must be one of those rare individuals whose... nerve endings don't register pain.

speaker: BLOCKHEAD
line: You just keep telling yourself that.

speaker: MULDER
line: Have you ever performed this tr, uh, act on anyone else?

speaker: BLOCKHEAD
line: What, are you sick? I tell my audiences that if they're stupid enough to try this themselves, they'll end up with a slight lobotomy. I am a professional.

speaker: MULDER
line: Exactly how does one become a professional blockhead? May I?

speaker: BLOCKHEAD
line: Starting in my homeland of Yemen, I studied with yogis, fakirs and swamis, learning the ancient arts of body manipulation. But most men know nothing of these arts. For instance, did you know that through the protective Chinese practice of Tiea Bu Shan, you can train your testicles to draw up into your abdomen?

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh, I'm doing that as we speak. I saw him this morning down by the river, he was eating a fish.

speaker: BLOCKHEAD
line: He knows between-show snacks will ruin his appetite.

speaker: MULDER
line: I could be mistaken. Maybe it was another bald-headed, jigsaw-puzzle-tattooed, naked guy I saw.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is this... man also a body manipulator?

speaker: BLOCKHEAD
line: No. In the classical sense, the Conundrum's a geek.

speaker: MULDER
line: He eats live animals.

speaker: BLOCKHEAD
line: He eats anything... live animals, dead animals, rocks, light bulbs, corkscrews, battery cables, cranberries...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Human flesh?

speaker: BLOCKHEAD
line: Only the Conundrum can answer that question. But he doesn't answer questions, he merely... poses them. When an audience partakes in the Conundrum's human piranha act, they are left to ask themselves... "Why." But... where are my manners?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Thank you. It's an old sleight of hand my uncle once taught me. He was only an amateur magician, but he was still better than those two.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, I'm going over to the lab to see if they can test the blood on the window against the blood on Doctor Blockhead's nail. Everybody's uncle is an amateur magician.

speaker: CURATOR
line: Welcome to my museum. May I put to rest any questions you may have conjured?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I was just reading about the fascinating life of Chang and Eng and wondering if their death was just as fascinating.

speaker: CURATOR
line: Oh, very much so. On a cold January eve in 1874, Eng awoke to find his brother had passed away during the course of the night. A few hours later, Eng himself departed from this world. Now, these facts themselves may be less than fascinating but imagine... imagine being Eng and lying there. Knowing that essentially half your body was now dead... that the rest must inevitably follow... and being able to do about it absolutely nothing. At the autopsy, it was officially concluded that Chang died of a cerebral hemorrhage.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And what was the official cause of Eng's death?

speaker: CURATOR
line: Fright.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Do you have any information on blockhead or geek acts?

speaker: CURATOR
line: This is a historical collection of human curiosities. Blockheads are skilled performers.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Like magicians?

speaker: CURATOR
line: Like sword swallowers who really do swallow swords. And geeks are neither skilled nor curiosities. They're merely unseemly... not even attaining the level of "gaffs."

speaker: SCULLY
line: "Gaffs?"

speaker: CURATOR
line: Observe closely the dissimilarity of the facial features. Conjoined twins are always identical. These twins are phonies... gaffs.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sort of like the Feejee Mermaid?

speaker: CURATOR
line: You're investigating the Alligator Man's murder, yes? I have something I believe you might find of some interest.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What does this have to do with the Glazebrook murder?

speaker: CURATOR
line: I've recently come into possession of an authentic P.T. Barnum exhibit. Now, I don't show this display to all my customers... only those with the intellectual curiosity to appreciate it. Barnum billed it as "the great unknown." I must first ask of you two favors. Tell no soul what you witness in here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And the second favor?

speaker: CURATOR
line: An additional donation of five dollars.

speaker: MULDER
line: Does Agent Scully know that you're under her crawlspace?

speaker: NUTT
line: I was merely repairing the plumbing on this unit. I know what you're thinking, my friend, but you are grossly mistaken. Just because I am not of so-called "average" height does not mean I must receive my thrills vicariously. Not all woman are attracted to overly tall, lanky men such as yourself. You'd be surprised how many women find my size intriguingly alluring.

speaker: MULDER
line: And you'd be surprised how many men do as well.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, it's you. Is Mister Nutt finished with the plumbing?

speaker: MULDER
line: The blood from the window matched the blood from the nail but they were both O-positive. They've been sent for further analysis. I ran a background check on Doctor Blockhead. His real name is Jeffrey Swaim and he wasn't born in Yemen, he was born in Milwaukee. He does not hold a doctorate.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, I ended up running a bit of a background check myself.

speaker: MULDER
line: On who?

speaker: SCULLY
line: On an orphan discovered in the wild forest of Albania in 1943. "Although physically adept at catching his own food, he could not speak a word, save for a few savage grunts. Brought to this country, he was exhibited behind a locked cage, necessitated by his feral ferocity, where he would terrify onlookers by devouring chunks of raw meat." However, for reasons I could not ascertain, he ran away from the circus and spent a vague number of years mysteriously roaming about, supporting himself through a number of non-descript jobs. Eventually, he wound up in Gibsonton, where he took up a career in law enforcement and has spent the past four terms serving as sheriff.

speaker: MULDER
line: You're talking about Sheriff Hamilton?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm telling you that before becoming Sheriff Hamilton, James Hamilton was Jim-Jim, the Dog-Faced Boy.

speaker: MULDER
line: You know, Scully, hypertricosis does not connote lycanthropy.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are you implying?

speaker: MULDER
line: We're being highly discriminatory here. Just because a man was once inflicted with excessive hairiness, we've no reason to suspect him of aberrant behavior.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's like assuming guilt based solely on skin color, isn't it?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah.

speaker: HAMILTON
line: May I ask what you're doing?

speaker: MULDER
line: We're exhuming... your potato.

speaker: HAMILTON
line: May I ask why?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sheriff, it, it's, it's been documented that many serial killers possess a fascination with police work, some of them even holding positions on their local force... so surveillance of investigation team members is often utilized as a precautionary...

speaker: MULDER
line: We found out you used to be the Dog-Faced Boy.

speaker: HAMILTON
line: Boy, look how skinny I was back then.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So that is you.

speaker: HAMILTON
line: Oh, sure. I spent the first half of my life as Jim-Jim. Then one morning I noticed a bald spot on top of my head and realized I was not only losing my hair but my career as well. Eventually all the hair went... on top of my head, anyways. The rest of my body is still pretty hairy, which is why I never go to the beach.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That doesn't quite explain the potato.

speaker: HAMILTON
line: I got, uh... some warts on my hand.

speaker: MULDER
line: That doesn't quite explain the potato.

speaker: HAMILTON
line: To get rid of warts, you rub a sliced potato on your hand and bury it under a full moon. Investigation isn't going too well, is it?

speaker: NUTT
line: So, tell me, Commodore... why are the weirdos the only ones that pay their rent checks in advance? I warn you, you tattooed cretin, I have a licensed firearm and I'm more than eager for an opportunity to use it!

speaker: LANNY
line: I found him. He's dead. He's dead...

speaker: HAMILTON
line: Lanny says all of the doors and windows were locked from the inside.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, come here!

speaker: LANNY
line: He was like a brother to me...

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know if a contortionist can get through that doggy-door, Scully, but look at this...

speaker: HAMILTON
line: Lanny! Lanny! Take it easy. You're going to hurt yourself.

speaker: LANNY
line: So what?

speaker: HAMILTON
line: So you might hurt me in the process. He gets this way sometimes. I'll have to toss him in the drunk tank.

speaker: MULDER
line: We'll take Jeffrey Swaim into custody.

speaker: HAMILTON
line: C'mon, Lanny, let's go...

speaker: SCULLY
line: You know, Mulder... For a while there, I was beginning to suspect this case involved something a bit more, um...

speaker: MULDER
line: Freakish? You really shouldn't complain about banality, Scully, when your main suspect is the human blockhead.

speaker: BLOCKHEAD
line: It's open!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mister Swaim, federal agents, we're here to qu...

speaker: BLOCKHEAD
line: It's a variation of an American Indian sun dance ritual. I suspend myself by these hooks and the pain becomes so unbearable I leave my body. If people knew the true price of spirituality, there'd be more atheists.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mister Swaim, we're here to take you into custody to question you about some recent murders.

speaker: BLOCKHEAD
line: I don't answer any questions until I talk to my lawyer.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who's your lawyer?

speaker: BLOCKHEAD
line: I represent myself.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sir, if you're going to be uncooperative, I'll have to handcuff you.

speaker: BLOCKHEAD
line: What gives you fascists the right to do that?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did I not mention we're federal agents?

speaker: BLOCKHEAD
line: Did I not mention I'm an escape artist?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, are you okay?

speaker: MULDER
line: It's more comfortable than a futon.

speaker: HAMILTON
line: Hey... look what I caught.

speaker: BLOCKHEAD
line: Ouch!

speaker: LANNY
line: What the hell? No! No!

speaker: BLOCKHEAD
line: This has all the makings of one of those mistaken identity, miscarriage of justice things that prove so popular on Sixty Minutes.

speaker: MULDER
line: Does this belong to you?

speaker: BLOCKHEAD
line: The fifth amendment of our beloved constitution says...

speaker: MULDER
line: What is that?

speaker: HAMILTON
line: It's Lanny in the drunk tank. He'll be all right once he sleeps it off.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, I don't think he's going to sleep this one off.

speaker: MULDER
line: There's been another attack.

speaker: HAMILTON
line: How could anyone have gotten in there?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No one got in, but some one got out.

speaker: MULDER
line: What are you talking about?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm not sure myself, Mulder, but I think we'll know more when we find Leonard.

speaker: MULDER
line: Leonard?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Lanny's brother.

speaker: HAMILTON
line: Oh, God, they extracted the twin.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, the twin extracted itself.

speaker: MULDER
line: But it's an appendage...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, Mulder... this wound is identical to the other victims' wounds. With one exception. He's not bleeding.

speaker: HAMILTON
line: If you're trying to tell me his twin brother can crawl out of his body and then go gallivant around town, you're as drunk as he is.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You said it yourself, Sheriff. It's what's inside that counts. I have a feeling that Lanny has an internal anomaly that allows his conjoining twin to disjoin

speaker: MULDER
line: But, how? H-how...

speaker: LANNY
line: How could I turn him in without turning myself in?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Lanny, why does he attack other people?

speaker: LANNY
line: I don't think he knows he's harming anyone. He's merely seeking... another brother.

speaker: HAMILTON
line: Are you in pain, Lanny?

speaker: LANNY
line: It hurts. It hurts not to be wanted. I don't know why he hates me so. I've taken care of him for all of our lives. Maybe that is the reason why.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How long can he survive outside of your body?

speaker: LANNY
line: Long enough... to understand that you cannot change the way you were born. Don't worry. He'll come back. He always does. I'm still his only brother.

speaker: MULDER
line: Sheriff, we're going to need the paramedics. Scully, you're the medical expert. If you think the twin can disengage, I believe you but how mobile could such a thing be?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Too mobile.

speaker: BLOCKHEAD
line: So your twin can, uh... And then... What an act!

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'll cover the back. Freeze! The funhouse.

speaker: MULDER
line: I thought I heard a shot fired.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I think we better go outside and catch this thing coming out. It's the manager's dog.

speaker: MULDER
line: The trailer park.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Are you all right?

speaker: MULDER
line: Have you seen a, uh... uh...

speaker: HAMILTON
line: Uh, check out the area behind that trailer. Let me know what you find. Now, you're sure it was the twin you saw running around here. I mean, maybe it was the Fiji Mermaid and he jumped back in the river and swum his way back to Fiji.

speaker: MULDER
line: Now you know how I feel.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're taking off?

speaker: BLOCKHEAD
line: With that thing still on the loose?

speaker: SCULLY
line: They've been searching for it all day. It can't have sustained itself for this long.

speaker: BLOCKHEAD
line: It will probably try to crawl back up into it's brother.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, his brother Lanny died last night. I already performed the autopsy on him this morning.

speaker: BLOCKHEAD
line: So, I guess it's true, you can never go home again.

speaker: SCULLY
line: His body wounds were non-fatal. He died as a result of advanced cirrhosis of the liver.

speaker: BLOCKHEAD
line: Oh, there's a moral to the story. Lay off the booze.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, his body possesses some anatomical discrepancies... some offshoots of the esophagus and trachea that almost seem umbilical in nature and... I've never seen anything like it.

speaker: BLOCKHEAD
line: And you never will again. Twenty-first century genetic engineering will not only eradicate the siamese twins and the alligator-skinned people, but you're going to be hard-pressed to find, uh, a slight overbite or a not-so-high cheek bone. You see, I've seen the future and the future looks just like him. Imagine going through your whole life looking like that. That's why it's left up to the self-made freaks like me and the Conundrum to remind people.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Remind people of what?

speaker: BLOCKHEAD
line: Nature abhors normality. It can't go very long without creating a mutant. Do you know why?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, why?

speaker: BLOCKHEAD
line: I don't either, it's a mystery. Maybe some mysteries are never meant to be solved.

speaker: MULDER
line: What's the matter with your friend?

speaker: BLOCKHEAD
line: I don't know what his problem is. Maybe it's the Florida heat.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hope it's nothing serious.

speaker: CONUNDRUM
line: Probably something I ate.
